metadata.title: Pilot Evaluation of RT-PCR/Electrospray Ionization Mass Spectrometry (PLEX-ID/Flu assay) on Influenza-Positive Specimens

abstract.original_text: The PLEX-ID/Flu assay has been recently developed to enable the detection and typing of influenza viruses based on the RT-PCR/electrospray ionization mass spectrometry technology.

sentences.segment_text: The PLEX-ID/Flu assay has been recently developed to enable the detection and typing of influenza viruses based on the RT-PCR/electrospray ionization mass spectrometry technology .

abstract.original_text: This novel assay was evaluated for typing performance on 201 positive influenza A or B nasopharyngeal swab specimens (NPS) detected by real-time RT-PCR during the 2010-2011 season. The PLEX-ID/Flu assay detected and characterized 91.3% and 95.3% of all influenza A and B samples, respectively. All non-typeable influenza A and B specimens by the assay showed low viral loads with threshold cycle values 33. Taken together, and although our results need to be confirmed by further prospective studies, the PLEX-ID/Flu assay detected positively and gave a typing result for 93% of all NPS detected positively by real-time RT-PCR, thus suggesting a potential role for influenza virus surveillance among other techniques.

sentences.segment_text: This novel assay was evaluated for typing performance on 201 positive influenza A or B nasopharyngeal swab specimens ( NPS ) detected by real-time RT-PCR during the 2010-2011 season .
The PLEX-ID/Flu assay detected and characterized 91.3 % and 95.3 % of all influenza A and B samples , respectively .
All non-typeable influenza A and B specimens by the assay showed low viral loads with threshold cycle values 33 .
Taken together , and although our results need to be confirmed by further prospective studies ,
the PLEX-ID/Flu assay detected positively and gave a typing result for 93 % of all NPS detected positively by real-time RT-PCR ,
thus suggesting a potential role for influenza virus surveillance among other techniques .
